title: Developing Presence: Exercises and Principles
first_phrase: In the previous section, we learned about the power of central gaze and how it can deeply affect our interlocutors. In this final section, we delve into the concept of "presence," the key to truly being there for ourselves. We are introduced to three exercises that can be performed during our daily activities to increase our presence and maintain our integrity of judgment even in the face of someone's penetrating gaze. These practices are essential for personal growth and development.
content: When, in company, you will put for some seconds an indifferent but firm and supported gaze on someone, mentally expressing the desire that this guy feels impelled to seek you, you will create in him this desire. Develop Presence to yourself As much as possible in everyday life, try â€œto be there for yourself". When you really understand this concept, you will realize how crucial it is. It is the absolute key. The exercises that we present here for presence are: 1) Exercise of the point of standing; to maintain for as long as possible 2) Exercise of "three times ten minutes", to create a space for the presence 3) More useful exercises When to perform the recommended exercises? None of these exercises will actually steal your time, since you will perform them contemporarily to your daily activities. In particular, the exercise of the point of standing and "three times ten minutes" they must be performed as often as possible.
last_phrase: To strengthen your fascinative force, develop the gift of presence. By mentally expressing the desire for someone to seek you while firmly gazing at them, you create the desire in them. To practice presence, try exercises like the point of standing and "three times ten minutes" during daily activities. Presence is an essential gift for yourself that will make you complete.
